Description: Finely carved decorative element of an item of furniture carved as a figure of the god Bes standing on a lotus-flower.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens & Commoners of the New Kingdom 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed 2011 6 Oct - 19 Feb, The British Museum, G35, 'Grayson Perry- Tomb of the Unknown Craftsman'
Acquisition name: Donated by: British Museum Friends (as British Museum Society)
